title: [K-12] Inquiry-Centered Blended Learning Design for Interdisciplinary Social Welfare Collaboration

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Social Welfare Theory and Practical Experience, with Basic Understanding of Related Disciplines (e.g., Psychology, Education)
context.additional_context: Cultivation of interdisciplinary problem-solving skills through parallel use of smartphone-based online collaboration tools and offline workshops

learning_goals: Through interdisciplinary team-based projects, learners can analyze social welfare field problems and propose integrated solutions.
In blended learning environments, learners can effectively communicate with experts from other fields using digital collaboration tools (e.g., KakaoTalk Open Chat, Google Docs).
Learners can self-assess their collaborative competencies based on formative feedback and establish improvement plans.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
